bill_title: to authorize sheriffs to collect fees for expenses incurred in executing court orders.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize sheriffs to collect fees for expenses incurred in executing court orders. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 7-12 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any sheriff may collect fees to recover reasonable expenses that are incurred as a result of executing an order of the court. The party who initiated the court action shall pay the fees and may pursue any available judicial remedy to recover such costs from the other parties involved in the action. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize sheriffs to collect fees for expenses incurred in executing court orders. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 7-12 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any sheriff may collect fees to recover reasonable expenses that are incurred as a result of executing an order of the court other than a protection order. The party who initiated the court action shall pay the fees and may pursue any available judicial remedy to recover such costs from the other parties involved in the action. BILL HISTORY January 27 - First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 171 February 3 - Passed as amended, AYES 6, NAYS 0. S.J. 295 February 3 - Placed on Consent. S.J. 295
